metadata.Name: TriviaQA
metadata.Description: TriviaQA is a large-scale reading comprehension dataset with over 650K question-answer-evidence triples, designed to test complex reasoning abilities. Questions are authored by trivia enthusiasts, and evidence is collected from web search results and Wikipedia.
metadata.Paper Title: TriviaQA: A Large Scale Distantly Supervised Challenge Dataset for Reading Comprehension
Affiliations: Paul G. Allen School of Computer Science & Engineering, Univ. of Washington
metadata.Abstract: We present TriviaQA, a new dataset of 650K question-document-evidence triples. To our knowledge, TriviaQA is the first dataset where questions are authored by trivia enthusiasts, independently of the evidence documents. The evidence documents come from two domains -- Web search results and Wikipedia pages -- with highly  differing  levels  of  information  redundancy. Results from current state-of-the-art baselines indicate that TriviaQA is a challenging testbed that deserves significant future study.
